event: Mouse click on empty desktop area.
description: The user right-clicked on the desktop. As a result, a context menu opened with the "Properties" option highlighted.
outcome: A context menu appeared on the desktop, offering options like "Arrange Icons By", "Refresh", "Paste", "New", and "Properties". The mouse cursor moved to hover over the "Properties" option.

event: The mouse is clicking on the "Properties" option in the context menu.
description: The user clicked "Properties" in the right-click context menu on the desktop. Consequently, the context menu closed, and the system displayed an hourglass cursor, indicating the display properties window is loading.
outcome: The right-click context menu disappeared and the mouse cursor changed to an hourglass shape, indicating system activity.

event: The mouse clicked on ScreSaver. The mouse is clicking on the "Screen Saver" tab of the "Display Properties" window.
description: The user clicked on the "Screen Saver" tab in the Display Properties window. As a result, the window's content updated to display the Screen Saver settings.
outcome: The Display Properties window updated to show the "Screen Saver" tab. The dropdown menu now offers screen saver options, the sample area displays a monitor image, and the "Wait" field shows a value of "10" minutes. The "Settings," "Preview," and "Power" buttons became visible, while the "Save As..." and "Delete" buttons are no longer present.

event: The mouse is clicking on the drop-down button of the "Screen saver" drop-down list.
description: The user clicked the dropdown button of the "Screen saver" dropdown list to open it. The list expanded to show "None" was selected.
outcome: The "Screen saver" dropdown menu changed its selection from "Windows XP" to "None".

event: The mouse clicked on (None. The mouse is clicking on "3D FlowerBox" in the "Screen saver" dropdown menu of the "Display Properties" window.
description: The user clicked on "3D FlowerBox" in the "Screen Saver" dropdown menu.  As a result, "3D FlowerBox" appears in the dropdown menu, and the "Settings" and "Preview" buttons are no longer greyed out.
outcome: The Display Properties window reflects the deactivation of the screen saver. The dropdown menu now displays "None," while both the "Settings" and "Preview" buttons are disabled.

event: Mouse click on the "Power..." button within the "Display Properties" window.
description: The user clicked the "Power..." button within the "Monitor power" section of the "Display Properties" window.  As a result, the "Power Options Properties" window opened in front of the "Display Properties" window.
outcome: A "Power Options Properties" window appeared in front of the "Display Properties" window. The "Screen Saver" dropdown menu, "Settings" button, "Preview" button, "Wait" input field and its "minutes" label, and the "On resume, password protect" checkbox are all absent from this new window.

event: Clicking the drop-down arrow for "Turn off monitor" setting.
description: The user clicked the dropdown arrow of the "Turn off monitor" setting within the "Power Options Properties" window.  The dropdown selection changed from "After 20 mins" to "Never".
outcome: The "Turn off monitor" setting within the "Power Options Properties" window changed from "After 20 mins" to "Never".

event: The mouse clicked on After 5 hours. The mouse is clicking on "Never" in the dropdown menu for "System hibernates:" in the "Display Properties" window.
description: The user clicked on "Never" in the "Turn off monitor" dropdown menu.  As a result, the dropdown menu closed, and "Never" was selected.
outcome: The "Turn off monitor" dropdown menu, showing "Never" selected, closed.

event: The mouse clicked on OK. The mouse is clicking on the OK button of the Display Properties window.
description: The user clicked "OK" in the "Power Options Properties" window.  As a result, the window closed.
outcome: The "Power Options Properties" window closed, and a maximized "Display Properties" window opened with the text cursor active.

event: The mouse clicked on OK. The mouse is clicking on the "OK" button.
description: The user clicked on the "OK" button at the bottom of the "Display Properties" window. As a result, the "Display Properties" window closed.
outcome: The Windows XP "Display Properties" window is open, but the "Screen Saver" tab is not fully loaded. Several controls related to screen saver settings, power management, and dialog actions are missing.
